briefs.title: $17B FEMA Aid Held Up - States Scrambling
briefs.summary: States facing delays, denials, cancellations of federal disaster funds. Budget pressures mounting. New Mexico added $30M emergency fund due to slower FEMA reimbursements.
briefs.author: Henry

additionalSources.name: Pew: What Waning Federal Aid Means for States
Pew: How States Can Build Disaster-Ready Budgets

keyFacts: $17 billion in FEMA aid to states currently held up by extra scrutiny
States already facing delays, denials, or cancellations at every stage
New Mexico added $30M to contingency fund due to slower FEMA reimbursements
State rainy day funds falling - would be insufficient to replace federal aid
Minnesota passed law to auto-transfer surplus to disaster contingency account
Massachusetts established statewide disaster account as guardrail
details.quote: States are now bracing because they don't know what will be expected of them in the disaster realm, capacity-wise. That part of FEMA is really important to states because they don't have the buying power to do that on their own.
details.sosOpportunity: States are building their own disaster capacity because they can't rely on FEMA. SOS sells directly to state emergency management agencies as the coordination layer they now need to own themselves. Pitch: 'Build state-owned disaster coordination capacity that doesn't depend on federal timelines.'
actionItems: Target states that added disaster contingency funds
Build case study: 'What NC could have done differently'

briefs.title: FEMA Being Gutted - States On Their Own
briefs.summary: Trump admin cutting CORE staff (40% of FEMA workforce). States will need alternative coordination tools. Perfect timing for SOS.
briefs.author: Henry

keyFacts: 50+ CORE disaster response workers terminated on New Year's Eve
CORE = 40% of FEMA workforce (~8,000 people), 'backbone of operations'
Contracts now require DHS approval to renew (previously routine)
FEMA Review Council proposing 50% workforce cut
GAO: Agency already 35% below target staffing (6,000+ short)
details.quote: FEMA can't do disaster response without CORE employees. The regional offices are almost entirely CORE staff. The impact is states are on their own.
details.sosOpportunity: States need alternatives. FEMA is becoming unreliable. SOS positioning: Community-first coordination that works WITH states, not above them. Capture institutional knowledge as FEMA staff leave.
actionItems: Update grant pitches with FEMA narrative
Research which states lost most FEMA staff
Find former CORE workers for testimonials

briefs.title: Palantir at $970M Federal Contracts
briefs.summary: Palantir doubled federal contracts in 2025. They're the surveillance play - SOS is the coordination play. Different buyers, different values.
briefs.author: Henry

keyFacts: Federal contracts nearly doubled to $970.5 million in 2025
ICE alone: $200M+ for Investigative Case Management
Also in: CDC, IRS, NYPD, many local police departments
whatGothamDoes: Integrates disparate data sources into unified, searchable web
Maps social networks, tracks movements, identifies physical characteristics
Creates detailed individual profiles from DMV, police, social media data
theirWeakness: Top-down government partner, not community tool
Extractive - takes data, doesn't build community capacity
details.sosDifferentiation: Palantir = surveillance play. SOS = coordination play. Different buyer (emergency managers vs law enforcement), different use case (humanitarian vs enforcement), different values (transparent vs black box).

briefs.title: Emergency Management Market: $1.1T+ Opportunity
briefs.summary: Homeland Security & Emergency Management market at $1.1 trillion. North America leads, key trend is 'integrated disaster response platforms'.
briefs.author: Henry

keyTrends: AI, blockchain, and thermal imaging adoption

briefs.title: Slack Integration Architecture Mapped
briefs.summary: Studied Slack platform docs. Custom workflow steps via Bolt JS for SOS integration. Can expose 'Create Need', 'Log Resource', 'Match Request' as steps.
briefs.author: Henry

details.approach: Bolt JS (self-hosted) over Deno SDK (Slack-hosted) - we already have Supabase edge functions
customSteps: Create Need - form to log new resource need
invocationTypes: Events API (react to app_mention, channel messages)
nextSteps: Define app manifest with custom steps
